oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriting Session - Priscilla Renea - 2018-07-28
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by songwriter Priscilla Renea from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on July 28, 2018. Includes appearances by friends John Prentice, Sonya Lee, Ashley Gorley, James Slater and Chris DeStefano.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Priscilla Renea;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (06:00) Opening comments and songwriter introduction by Abi Tapia / (08:51) Opening comments by Priscilla and introduction of guitarist John Prentice who accompanied most songs / (09:24) Introduces the first song / (10:48) Performs California King Bed / (15:03) Introduces the next song / (16:58) Performs Who Says / (19:45) Introduces the next song / (22:12) Performs Timber / (24:08) Introduces friend Sonya Lee (24:55) Sonya Lee talks about working with Priscilla / (25:55) Introduces the next song / (27:11) Performs Millennials (Sonya Lee and John on guitars) / (30:16) Introduces the next song / (31:45) Performs Lifetime (Sonya Lee and John on guitars) / (35:52) Introduces friend James Slater and introduces the next song / (37:17) Performs Heavenly (with James Slater on piano) / (41:29) Introduces Ashley Gorley and introduces the next song / (43:45) Performs Build A House / (48:47) Introduces the next song / (49:36) Performs If I Ever Loved You (with James Slater on piano) / (54:02) Introduces the next song and friend Chris DeStefano / (56:01) Performs Hotel / (59:51) Introduces the next song / (01:02:32) Performs Somethin’ Bad / (01:05:38) Final comments / (01:05:55) Walk-out music / (01:09:00) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Renea, Priscilla; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
